biotools.summary: The GGB (Gaggle Genome Browser) is an open source software tool for visualizing high-density data plotted against coordinates on the genome. Tiling arrays, ChIP-chip, and high-throughput sequencing are a few potential use-cases. The genome browser is designed to gracefully handle large datasets, allow easy import of user data, and interoperate with other bioinformatics tools through the Gaggle framework.
